intro: Parathesis cuspidata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed parathesis, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
